articles.headline: Hillary Clinton’s Long, Grueling Quest
articles.snippet: As a politician’s wife, first lady, senator and secretary of state — and as a two-time candidate for president — Hillary Clinton has continually redefined the role of women in American politics.
articles.abstract: As a politician’s wife, first lady, senator and secretary of state — and as a two-time candidate for president — Hillary Clinton has continually redefined the role of women in American politics.
articles.lead_paragraph: If there was a single moment that captured what would carry Hillary Clinton to the 2016 Democratic nomination, it came not during her sun-splashed campaign kickoff in New York last June, or in any of her speeches celebrating hard-fought primary victories over Senator Bernie Sanders.

articles.headline: F.B.I. Steps Up Use of Stings in ISIS Cases
articles.snippet: A sharp rise in the number of undercover operations, once considered a last resort, has come with little public or congressional scrutiny.
articles.abstract: A sharp rise in the number of undercover operations, once considered a last resort, has come with little public or congressional scrutiny.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The F.B.I. has significantly increased its use of stings in terrorism cases, employing agents and informants to pose as jihadists, bomb makers, gun dealers or online “friends” in hundreds of investigations into Americans suspected of supporting the Islamic State, records and interviews show.

articles.headline: Defiant Bashar al-Assad Vows to Retake ‘Every Inch’ of Syria
articles.snippet: Syria’s president offered no hint of compromise in a national speech, dimming hope for peace talks and rejecting the West’s efforts to provide aid.
articles.abstract: Syria’s president offered no hint of compromise in a national speech, dimming hope for peace talks and rejecting the West’s efforts to provide aid.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Syria’s president promised to retake “every inch” of the country from his foes on Tuesday in a defiant speech that appeared to reject the humanitarian relief effort and peaceful transition of power that the United States, Russia and more than a dozen other nations have pressed for since last fall.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger and Rick Gladstone

articles.headline: Microsoft Finds Cancer Clues in Search Queries
articles.snippet: Analyzing queries on Bing, researchers found warning signs of symptoms of pancreatic cancer before the disease was diagnosed.
articles.abstract: Analyzing queries on Bing, researchers found warning signs of symptoms of pancreatic cancer before the disease was diagnosed.
articles.lead_paragraph: Microsoft scientists have demonstrated that by analyzing large samples of search engine queries they may in some cases be able to identify internet users who are suffering from pancreatic cancer, even before they have received a diagnosis of the disease.

articles.headline: The Web’s Creator Looks to Reinvent It
articles.snippet: Tim Berners-Lee and other computer scientists are pondering newer technologies to create a web with more privacy and less government control.
articles.abstract: Tim Berners-Lee and other computer scientists are pondering newer technologies to create a web with more privacy and less government control.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Twenty-seven years ago, Tim Berners-Lee created the World Wide Web as a way for scientists to easily find information. It has since become the world’s most powerful medium for knowledge, communications and commerce — but that doesn’t mean Mr. Berners-Lee is happy with all of the consequences.

articles.headline: Design Within Reach Merger Never Happened, Lawsuit Claims
articles.snippet: The 2014 deal with Herman Miller was badly botched, plaintiffs claim, and shareholders have been deprived of a lot of value.
articles.abstract: The 2014 deal with Herman Miller was badly botched, plaintiffs claim, and shareholders have been deprived of a lot of value.
articles.lead_paragraph: To many in the furniture industry, the 2014 merger of Herman Miller, the famed purveyor of midcentury classics like the Eames lounge chair, and Design Within Reach, the emporium for sleek modern furnishings, was a no-brainer.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: After Victory in California, Hillary Clinton Turns Toward Donald Trump
articles.snippet: Mrs. Clinton’s victory in four states extended her lead, but Senator Bernie Sanders would not concede.
articles.abstract: Mrs. Clinton’s victory in four states extended her lead, but Senator Bernie Sanders would not concede.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton claimed the Democratic presidential nomination on Tuesday night after decisive victories in the California, New Jersey and New Mexico primaries, and she quickly appealed to supporters of Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont to unite with her against Donald J. Trump.
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: Warriors, Tech’s Team, Are Soaring Out of Reach
articles.snippet: The Golden State Warriors are almost a metaphor for the way the tech industry improves, and also risks ruining, all that it touches.
articles.abstract: The Golden State Warriors are almost a metaphor for the way the tech industry improves, and also risks ruining, all that it touches.
articles.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — As soon as I got to Oracle Arena last week for the first game of the N.B.A. finals, I started scanning the floor for tech bigwigs.

articles.headline: Netflix Studied Your Binge-Watching Habit. That Didn’t Take Long.
articles.snippet: The streaming service that has upended the traditional television model says its subscribers generally finish a show’s first season in a week.
articles.abstract: The streaming service that has upended the traditional television model says its subscribers generally finish a show’s first season in a week.
articles.lead_paragraph: At a time with more scripted television than ever, how long does it take to finish a season of a show?

articles.headline: E3, Fading Catnip for Video Gamers, Tries a New Approach
articles.snippet: E3 has lost some industry participants in what was once a premier event, but it is adjusting its lineup and adding an event for gamers.
articles.abstract: E3 has lost some industry participants in what was once a premier event, but it is adjusting its lineup and adding an event for gamers.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is a holy week in every gamer’s calendar. Each June, 50,000 members of the video game industry descend upon Los Angeles for the Electronic Entertainment Expo, or E3, the industry’s most-anticipated trade show. E3 often features the unveiling of big titles and celebrity appearances from the likes of Paul McCartney and Rihanna.
